name: EasyContent
author: EasyContent

sections.description:
Installing EasyContent WordPress plugin allows you to transfer content between your WordPress website and your EasyContent account. You can pull all or some of your EasyContent articles into your WordPress website, or push some of your WordPress posts or pages directly into your EasyContent account. Once your WordPress post or page is linked, you can change its EasyContent status or update its content right from your WordPress admin panel.

In your plugin settings, you can define the default parameters for your imported posts or pages, as well as map your WordPress categories to your EasyContent categories. The plugin works with All in One SEO Pack and Yoast SEO, two most popular SEO plugins for WordPress. So your post SEO metadata will be synced as well.

The images that you attach to your EasyContent articles will be uploaded directly to your WordPress media library. Our plugin can also resize and/or compress your attached images if you choose to.

What is EasyContent?

EasyContent is a content collaboration and workflow management platform. It enables teams to create and review content and publish it to WordPress with one click of a button, at scale.

It has the following features:

  1. Powerful text editor that works fine with WordPress Gutenberg editor
  2. Unlimited number of projects
  3. Customizable roles and approval workflows
  4. Feedback and annotations
  5. Editorial calendar
  6. Change tracking
  7. Activity reporting and email notifications
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload easycontent-wp to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Click on the menu item “EasyContent”
  4. In the “EasyContent connection” tab add your public and private API keys. You can generate your API keys in the ‘Integrations’ section of your EasyContent account.
sections.faq:
Where can I report a bug?

You can report it on a plugin support page, by sending us a message on our landing page or by filling this form.

sections.screenshots:
1. Page that allows you to import one or several EasyContent articles into your Wordpress website.

  2. Add your EasyContent API keys into the 'EasyContent connection' tab to connect your website to EasyContent.

  3. The 'Publishing options' tab allows you to configure some default options for your imported posts or pages.

  4. Bulk Push and Pull operations are available on your 'All posts' page.

  5. Once the posts or pages are linked, you'll see their EasyContent status in the 'EasyContent status' column.

  6. Our plugin works well with Gutenberg. While editing your page or post in Wordpress, you can push it to EasyContent or pull new content from EasyContent to Wordpress.

  7. The plugin can resize and/or compress your images while importing them from EasyContent into your Wordpress media library.
sections.reviews:
Does its Job Flawlessly

By optimisticrandy on December 11, 2021

We’re using EasyContent.io for team collaboration and we use this plugin to automatically publish articles from EasyContent to our WordPress site. Works great and with little to no issues so far.

Perfect Companion Plugin

By iamsurvivall on November 27, 2021

My team uses EasyContent.com to produce web content for WordPress sites. This companion plugin works perfectly with the web app.

Works Great

By Danny S (dannyspasticss) on November 13, 2021

This companion plugin helps us transfer our article from EasyContent to our website. This eliminates the need to manually copy and paste content, which can be prone to errors. Also works with Yoast!

Made Our Publishing Workflow Much Easier

By juppalsingh on November 9, 2021

Much easier to track where an article is in the publishing workflow compared to using Google Docs and Google Sheets. We used Google Docs to write the article and a separate Google Sheet to track where an article is in the publishing workflow. It can get messy. Thanks to EasyContent, we have 2 tools in 1: a place to write the content and track where it is in the workflow and more.
